page.title: 07The Farmers Year
page.content: We looked at Old Hall farm close to Bagnall to find out how the farmer spent his time. The farm is owned by Mr and Mrs Brown and has 80 acres of land.The farm was built in the 1700's and five people live on the farm,looking after 80 dairy cattles. The cattle need constant attention being milked twice a day, 6am in the morning and 6pm at night.In the Summer after milking they have to cut the grass for silage. In the Spring they have to roll and harrow and then fertilize the land before they sow the grass. In the Autumn they take the cows in for Winter and plough the land while in Winter they do repair work and general cleaning.
